intro: Cryptantha jamesii var. disticha, commonly known as the Sierra cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its delicate, blue to purple flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in mountainous regions, preferring full sun. It has small, oval-shaped leaves and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. This species is adapted to arid environments and is often found in chaparral and sagebrush habitats.
